title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer provides David de Gea update as he's ruled out of Liverpool clash
text:

Manchester United have suffered a double blow with David De Gea and Paul Pogba ruled out of Sunday’s showdown with Liverpool.

Pogba, who has missed five of United’s last seven games with an ankle injury, had been expected to return, but boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has confirmed he is out.

De Gea, who suffered a groin injury on Tuesday while on international duty with Spain, has also been ruled out of the clash with United’s fiercest rivals and runaway Premier League leaders.

Solskjaer said: “David needs a scan. I think he'll be out. It certainly looked like it anyway, judging on last night, so it's just one of those things.

(Image: RICHARD WAINWRIGHT/EPA-EFE/REX)

“Paul had an injury, he came back, he worked really hard. He came back and played a couple of games, maybe played through the pain barrier.

“He had a scan after the Arsenal game and maybe needed a few weeks' rest in a boot, so hopefully he won't be too long, but he won't make this game, no."

Pogba flew out to Dubai during the international break for a warm weather training camp in a bid to ensure he would be fit for the Liverpool clash at Old Trafford.

(Image: Anders Wiklund/TT/EPA-EFE/REX)

But the 26-year-old has been forced to concede defeat in his bid to make the game that could prove to be a defining moment in United’s already troubled season.

Solskjaer is under increasing pressure, with United down in 12th place, already 15 points behind Liverpool and just two points off the relegation zone, after their worst start to a league campaign for 30 years.

United have struggled for goals and creativity this season, which is why Solskjaer was desperate for Pogba to make the Liverpool game, to give his side some much-needed flair.

(Image: Getty Images)

De Gea sustained his groin injury during Spain’s 1-1 draw away to Sweden in a Euro 2020 qualifier, the 28-year-old forced off just after the second-half, after complaining of the problem at half-time.

Sergio Romero, United’s No.2, will come into the side for his first league start of the season and only his third appearance of the campaign, with third-choice Lee Grant stepping up to the bench.
description: Manchester United take on bitter rivals Liverpool on Sunday without David de Gea or Paul Pogba
